text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

text: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Mae West

text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

text: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
author: Francis of Assisi

text: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
author: William Shakespeare

text: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
author: Swami Sivananda

text: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth,faithfulness the best relationship.
author: Buddha

text: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle Onassis

text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
author: Aesop

text: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.
author: Robin Williams

text: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
author: Edith Wharton

text: I believe in living today. Not in yesterday, nor in tomorrow.
author: Loretta Young

text: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
author: St. Jerome

text: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.
author: George S. Patton

text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

text: In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
author: Ralph Marston

text: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
author: Og Mandino

text: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
author: Ayn Rand

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C. S. Lewis

text: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
author: Og Mandino

text: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

text: Infuse your life with action. I have not failed. I’ve just found 10,000 ways that won’t work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope.
author: Bradley Whitford

text: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential… these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
author: Confucius

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

text: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

text: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.
author: W. Clement Stone

text: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
author: Robert H. Schuller

text: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Work hard for what you want because it won't come to you without a fight.
author: Leah LaBelle

text: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
author: Helen Keller

text: In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: To succeed, you need to find something to hold on to, something to motivate you, something to inspire you.
author: Tony Dorsett

text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

text: Your smile will give you a positive countenance that will make people feel comfortable around you.
author: Les Brown

text: Once you replace negative thoughts with positive ones, you'll start having positive results.
author: Willie Nelson

text: If you're not making mistakes, then you're not doing anything. I'm positive that a doer makes mistakes.
author: John Wooden

text: Live life to the fullest, and focus on the positive.
author: Matt Cameron

text: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.
author: Joyce Meyer

text: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.
author: Khalil Gibran

text: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
author: George Sand

text: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it.
author: Richard Bach

text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Happiness is good health and a bad memory.
author: Ingrid Bergman

text: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
author: Omar Khayyam

text: Remember that the happiest people are not those getting more, but those giving more.
author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

text: Some cause happiness whereverthey go; others whenever they go.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Most folks are as happy as they make up their minds to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Action may not always bring happiness; but there is no happiness without action.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

text: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
author: Helen Keller

text: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
author: Walter Winchell

text: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
author: Mencius

text: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
author: Euripides

text: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
author: Albert Camus

text: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.
author: Henry Ford

text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

text: Always be yourself, express yourself, have faith in yourself, do not go out and look for a successful personality and duplicate it.
author: Bruce Lee

text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: A single twig breaks, but the bundle of twigs is strong.
author: Tecumseh

text: The first step toward change is awareness. The second step is acceptance.
author: Nathaniel Branden

text: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
author: Robert Frost

text: We are not makers of history. We are made by history.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Subtlety may deceive you; integrity never will.
author: Oliver Cromwell

text: Growth is the only evidence of life.
author: John Henry Newman

text: Trust, but verify.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Shadows cannot see themselves in the mirror of the sun.
author: Evita Peron

text: Even if you’re on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

text: I like nonsense; it wakes up the brain cells.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: I don't go around regretting things that don’t happen.
author: Virgil Thomson

text: Our patience will achieve more than our force.
author: Edmund Bruke

text: Genius is more often found in a cracked pot than in a whole one.
author: E.B. White

text: Only in love are unity and duality not in conflict.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

text: I wear my heart on my sleeve.
author: Princess Diana

text: Life laughs at you when you are unhappy. Life smiles at you when you are happy. But, life salutes you when you make others happy.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: The sun is new each day.
author: Heraclitus

text: There was never a night or a problem that could defeat sunrise or hope.
author: Bernard Williams

text: Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you’ll start to see a big difference in your life.
author: Yoko Ono

text: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it.
author: Richard Bach

text: Beauty is a shot-lived tyranny.
author: Socrates

text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

text: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
author: Edith Wharton

text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Life is about making your own happiness - and living by your own rules.
author: Aimee Mullins

text: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
author: Margaret Mead

text: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Too much agreement kills a chat.
author: Eldridge Cleaver

text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

text: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
author: Duke Ellington

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: Nobody who ever gave his best regretted it.
author: George Halas

text: You can do anything, but not everything.
author: David Allen

text: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: The richest man is not he who has the most, but he who needs the least.
author: Unknown Author

text: You miss 100 percent of the shots you never take.
author: Unknown Author

text: Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgement that something else is more important than fear.
author: Ambrose Redmoon

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

text: We are what we repeatedly do; excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.
author: Baltasar Gracian

text: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the men of old; seek what they sought.
author: Basho

text: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new lands but seeing with new eyes.
author: Marcel Proust

text: Work like you don’t need money, love like you’ve never been hurt, and dance like no one’s watching
author: Unknown Author

text: People often say that motivation doesn’t last. Well, neither does bathing – that’s why we recommend it daily.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I quit therapy because my analyst was trying to help me behind my back.
author: Richard Lewis

text: If the lessons of history teach us anything it is that nobody learns the lessons that history teaches us.
author: Anon

text: Laughing at our mistakes can lengthen our own life. Laughing at someone else’s can shorten it.
author: Cullen Hightower

text: The person who reads too much and uses his brain too little will fall into lazy habits of thinking.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it.
author: André Gide

text: I’d rather live with a good question than a bad answer.
author: Aryeh Frimer

text: We learn something every day, and lots of times it’s that what we learned the day before was wrong.
author: Bill Vaughan

text: Don’t ever wrestle with a pig. You’ll both get dirty, but the pig will enjoy it.
author: Cale Yarborough

text: An inventor is simply a fellow who doesn’t take his education too seriously.
author: Charles F. Kettering

text: Better to write for yourself and have no public, than to write for the public and have no self.
author: Cyril Connolly

text: Never be afraid to laugh at yourself, after all, you could be missing out on the joke of the century.
author: Dame Edna Everage

text: I am patient with stupidity but not with those who are proud of it.
author: Edith Sitwell

text: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
author: Ellen Parr

text: When a person can no longer laugh at himself, it is time for others to laugh at him.
author: Thomas Szasz

text: If you don’t build your dream, someone else will hire you to help them build theirs.
author: Dhirubhai Ambani

text: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you don’t value your time, neither will others. Stop giving away your time and talents. Value what you know and start charging for it.
author: Kim Garst

text: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
author: David Brinkley

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn’t do than by the ones you did do.
author: Mark Twain

text: Success is about creating benefit for all and enjoying the process. If you focus on this and adopt this definition, success is yours.
author: Kelly Kim

text: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The successful warrior is the average man, with lasers like focus.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life – think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
author: Swami Vivekananda

text: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: If you don’t design your own life plan, chances are you’ll fall into someone else’s plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
author: Jim Rohn

text: The question isn’t who is going to letme; it’s who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

text: If you genuinely want something, don’t wait for it – teach yourself to be impatient.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: Don’t let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

text: If you want to make a permanent change, stop focusing on the size of your problems and start focusing on the size of you!
author: T. Harv Eker

text: Be a Warrior not a Worrier
author: Unknown Author

text: Be not afraid of going slowly, be afraid only of standing still.
author: Unknown Author

text: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
author: Unknown Author

text: Happiness will never come to those who fail to appreciate what they already have.
author: Unknown Author

text: Without His love I can do nothing, with His love there is nothing I cannot do.
author: Unknown Author

text: Here is only one happiness in life — to love and to be loved.
author: George Sand

text: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life. It goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: And in the end, it's not the years in your life that count. It's the life in your years.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Where there is love there is life.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: Life can only be understood backwards, but it must be lived forward.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

text: Teachers open the door but you must walk through it yourself.
author: Unknown Author

text: Chose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius
